page.title: 04An Eckington farm.
page.content: My dad told me we have approximately 40 acres of grass ,which makes one hundred tonnes of hay, which is mainly sold in Wales for cattle and sheep feed. Dad also grows arable crops, there are 41 acres of wheat and 10 acres of field beans. Wheat seed is planted in October at 75 kilos per acre. It is harvested in late August, with an average yield of 2.5 tonnes per acre. If the moisture content is 16% or less, it may be stored until the following July. Most varities of wheat are sold for animal feed. Field beans are planted in late October at 100 kilos per acre. They are harvested in September at an average of 1.5 tonnes per acre. They are sold as a high protein mix for animal feeds. We also work as Agricultural Contractors, which consists of working tractors and machinery on other farms.
